Description: Sandstone water-spout in the form of the fore-part of a lion, the channel running, between the paws, reconstructed, with traces of red paint on the mouth.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Bibliography: W.M.F. Petrie, Koptos, London 1896, p. 22
Register records 'Transferred from the Victoria and Albert Museum (Dept. of Architecture and Sculpture) under B.O.S. R.P.'s 77/1872.'.
Published in B. Ventker, Der Starke auf dem Dach: Funktion und Bedeutung der loewengestaltigen Wasserspeier im alten Aegypten, p. 271 no. 17 (SsR 6; Wiedbaden: Harrassowitz 2012).
Bibliographic references: Adams 1977 / Egyptian objects in the Victoria and Albert Museum (p.17)
Acquisition name: Transferred from: Victoria and Albert Museum
